explore.title: Paragliding in Morocco
explore.subtitle: With the Atlas Mountains spanning much of the country, Morocco offers a diverse and stunning landscape to explore from the sky.
explore.blurb: Morocco is an excellent winter destination for pilots seeking thermals, especially when skies are dull and gray back home. Weather reliability makes for a great winter escape. From soaring over high mountains and flatlands to dune flying, every pilot will discover their favorite playground. Morocco is only a couple of hours’ flight from most European countries.

rules.title: Flying Legally in Morocco
rules.subtitle: Everything you need to fly safely and legally—airspace downloads, flight declarations, and required forms.

rulesNav.title: Flying requirements
rulesNav.requirements: In order to fly in Morocco, there are a few requirements to meet: current third party liability, apply for free flying authorisation, fly in designated areas

q2.q: Do I need permission to fly XC?
q2.a: You are allowed to fly XC within the designated areas.

q1.q: What happens if I fly without authorisation?
q1.a: Flying without permission may result in legal consequences or restrictions from local authorities. It’s not worth the risk—always apply.

q3.q: How do I submit the authorisation form (Annexe 2/4)?
q3.a: Print your completed form and submit it to the CAA office in Rabat. Some local clubs may offer assistance with the process.

q4.a: Bringing aviation radios (VHF/2m band) into Morocco is officially restricted.

q5.q: What to do in case the CAA doesn't respond?
q5.a: If you submitted your application at least 30 days before your trip and received no reply, tacit approval applies by law.

annexe2Disclaimer.intro: By signing the Annex 2, you are agreeing to the following Moroccan legal requirements:

items.0: Send to the Moroccan <abbrCAA>CAA</abbrCAA> the documents regarding the aircraft
items.1: Remain in the geographical coordinates as described in the Moroccan <airspaceLink>airspaces page</airspaceLink>
items.2: Comply with <abbrVFR>VFR</abbrVFR> as described in Moroccan regulations
items.3: Comply with the limitations regarding flight and landing areas as defined by the authorities
items.4: Obtain prior approval from the relevant local authorities (civil and military) for ground coordination and conducting flights outside of aerodromes
items.5: Coordinate flight execution with the commanders of the concerned airports
items.6: Coordinate the start and end of the activity with the aerodrome’s air navigation services or, where applicable, with the relevant local authorities
items.7: Ensure that all participants are informed of aeronautical information (NOTAMs)
items.8: Ensure that an emergency beacon (406 MHz) is carried on board the aircraft
items.9: Ensure that briefings and debriefings are conducted for each flight
items.10: Ensure that communication devices are present on board the aircraft

aglou.name: Aglou
aglou.description: Located 2 hours south of Agadir, Aglou is a great playground for paragliding pilots. It is amazing to practice ground handling, takeoffs and landings. The craziest one even practices wagga!
aglou.longDescription: It is an amazing site which works all year around in Morocco especially when there is good sea breeze from NW. To access to this site you'll have to do some dune driving which include soft sands. Many vehicles get stuck there, especially when it's your first time driving around. But with extra help and some human power can take a car out of this situation.
aglou.takeoff: Aglou is a big dune that can be flown on a very long stretch. You'll be flying over the cave house where seasonal fishing communities live. There is some local rock to avoid but it is extremely easy takeoff.
aglou.landing: Landing can be done anywhere except in the cave house terraces and gardens. It can be done at the bottom on the beach, on the slope of the dune or top landing.
aglou.flying: It is a coastal site and has a very laminar flow which make it a perfect beginner site.
aglou.hazard: Rocks, cave houses, vehicles. For barefoot people, sharp shells, piece of glass so not recommended!

aguergour.name: Aguergour
aguergour.description: Aguergour is one of the most famous sites in Morocco, the Moroccan Annecy, it is located only an hour away from Marrakech. It's the best paragliding site in Morocco. It is an easy site with a designated take off area and landing zone.
aguergour.longDescription: From Marrakech, take the direction to Lalla Takerkouste. Once in Lalla Takerkouste, you'll need to follow Moulay Brahim/Ouzguita direction. Take off is accessible with a 4x4 or a high car but it can be steep and tricky to access. Two clubs operate on this site, Aguergour Eagles and Vol Libre
aguergour.takeoff: The takeoff is only accessible by foot after a 20 to 30min walk up through goat tracks. The ridge is very steep/cliff on most of its length and takeoff can be performed all along the ridge but there are only two areas where it is relatively easy to takeoff from. The takeoff is rocky ready to catch one or two lines.
aguergour.landing: There is no official landing area but most people will land on the far west where you start to walk from. You may land anywhere suitable bearing in mind that the ground is not flat at the bottom.
aguergour.flying: This sites need an authorisation from the CAA and local government to fly (Free flying rules). Requirement - Marrakech ATC must be informed the day before of the start and the end of arial activities. Contact: BAFRA/ Marrakech 05 24 43 04 11 / 05 24 44 79 17. The ridge can be soared all on its length. The site is a spine ridge and will present rotors on the lee side.
aguergour.hazard: It is a rocky terrain with some toxic cacti at the bottom. There is potential scorpions hiding under rocks in this area. The site will have rotor on its lee side and it is no recommended to fly there unless you have enough clearance to fly away.
aguergour.legislation: Marrakech ATC must be informed the day before of the start and the end of arial activities. Contact: BAFRA/ Marrakech 05 24 43 04 11 / 05 24 44 79 17.

guigou.name: Guigou
guigou.description: Guigou is one of the most spectacular sites in the Mid Atlas area. This paragliding site isn't often visited by foreign pilots. This area is one of the coldest area of Morocco, it snows every winter.
guigou.longDescription: On the map above, you'll find a good part of Guigou's ridge. The parking is in the plain and the takeoff can be done anywhere on the first third up the slope. You'll be soaring back up the slope to fly this site. There is possibilities for takeoff at the top but at the moment it is only goat tracks. Landing is in the plain avoiding the onions fields.
guigou.takeoff: Takeoff will be done either the first third up the slope or from the top after following goat tracks.
guigou.landing: Landing can be done anywhere minding cultures and lands. Take care for local powerlines.
guigou.flying: The ridge is about 25km long, it is possible to takeoff at the bottom and soar all the way up to explore the whole ridge. Major powerlines are running in this region.
guigou.hazard: This site is directly located under the Fes TMA and local aviation may take place. Please refer to the airspace panel for further information.

tizi-n-test.name: Tizi-N-Test
tizi-n-test.description: Tizi-N-Test is a paragliding site in the high Atlas, a small pass connecting Marrakech to Taroundant at 2,093 meters high. This is a high mountain takeoff.
tizi-n-test.longDescription: This site works with valley breeze and thermals. It can be turbulent and difficult to fly but the landing is the most technical aspect for this site.
tizi-n-test.takeoff: The takeoff is directly below the road and the restaurant, the restaurant owner will help you to locate it if you need help. It is steep and covered of gravel which makes is slippery. There are cacti around the takeoff that will catch you if you slip.
tizi-n-test.landing: The landing is NOT at the bottom of the valley but further away by the road. It is a slightly, and the only flat lands around this area. It is extremely difficult to land anywhere else in this area. The Gendarmes will wait for you at the landing to check on your authorisation.
tizi-n-test.flying: This site is in the high atlas and it has an alpine regime with valley breeze, lee side thermals, etc. It is a very technical site and it is not recommended to fly there unless you are an experienced pilot. The site is not recommended for beginners.
tizi-n-test.hazard: The takeoff and the landing are the most technical aspect of this site.

ait-ourir.name: Ait Ourir
ait-ourir.description: Ait Ourir is an amazing site to fly paragliding an hour away from Marrakech. It works like Aguergour meaning that it takes the same wind orientation and mainly work with anabatic flow from Marrakech to the High Atlas behind.
ait-ourir.longDescription: Unlike Aguergour, you'll have to walk to the top to be able to take off but fortunately, it is still accessible through goat tracks as long as you're aiming to the top.
ait-ourir.takeoff: The takeoff is only accessible by foot after a 20 to 30min walk up through goat tracks. The ridge is very steep/cliff on most of its length and takeoff can be performed all along the ridge but there is only two area where it is relatively easy to takeoff from. The takeoff is rocky ready to catch one or two lines.
ait-ourir.landing: There is no official landing area but most people will land on the far west where you start to walk from. You may land anywhere suitable bearing in mind that the ground is not flat at the bottom.
ait-ourir.flying: This sites need an authorisation from the CAA and local government to fly (Free flying rules).
ait-ourir.hazard: It is a rocky terrain with some toxic cacti at the bottom. There is potential scorpions hiding under rocks in this area. The site will have rotor on its lee side and it is no recommended to fly there unless you have enough clearance to fly away. The ridge can be soared all on its length. The site is a spine ridge and will present rotors on the lee side.
ait-ourir.legislation: Marrakech ATC must be informed the day before of the start and the end of arial activities. Contact: BAFRA/ Marrakech 05 24 43 04 11 / 05 24 44 79 17.

plage-blanche.name: Plage Blanche
plage-blanche.description: Beach, fly and fun! This is Plage Blanche, another surf and paragliding paradise in Guelmin region.
plage-blanche.longDescription: To access the spot, you need to go as far away from the military outpost at the beginning of the road. They are not happy to see us flying in this area, but Plage Blanche is a massive area. The road may be tricky as it involves dune driving and passing the riverbed is the most difficult point of the journey.
plage-blanche.takeoff: Takeoff can be done the other side of the river, well away from the military outpost.
plage-blanche.flying: It is a coastal site with a laminar flow. It works best with NW winds.
plage-blanche.hazard: Some rocks need to be avoided.

nid-d-aigle.name: Nid d'Aigle
nid-d-aigle.description: One of the major paragliding site in Southern Morocco located only 2 hours south of Agadir, between Mirleft and Tiznit. This site works with sea breeze and thermals from the kilometre of land in front enabling cloudbase flying and cross country to Aglou (and sometimes back).
nid-d-aigle.longDescription: The takeoffs are by the restaurants are the top. They are private land and there is a takeoff fees for the day of 30 Dhs per person per day. There are options for restauration and accommodation. The takeoffs have parkings and easily accessible by cars or campers!
nid-d-aigle.takeoff: Both takeoffs are private and there is a small daily fee of 30Dhs. Nigel's takeoff is more forgiving than the other Nid d'Aigle for beginner with a rounder and smoother longer runway end.
nid-d-aigle.landing: Top land is done on the land by the Nid d'Aigle bearing in mind little turbulence by the cliff edge or on Nigel's takeoff without flying over the buildings. Bottom landing can be done by the road but this area is small and sloping away, it is not the easiest for beginners. The other option is to land by the small concrete cubic hut which is a beginner area and easier to approach.
nid-d-aigle.flying: This site works with thermals and gust can be observed. The site is so popular that it can be crowded by other pilots.
nid-d-aigle.hazard: Directly down of the takeoff there are cacti that won't forgive any landing there. The site have some rough cliff edge and a good clearance should be taken while soaring close to the terrain. Small buildings of the restaurant and hotel create rotors while on a top landing approach and it is best to keep away from them. There is a small power line running by the road to be avoided.

m-zouda.name: M'Zouda
m-zouda.description: This site is a thermic site located in Marrakech region, there is not a lot of space for soaring.
m-zouda.longDescription: Parking is done just above the takeoff. The landing is done in the riverbed. In order to fly this site, you need to go and meet the authorities, at least the Gendarmes, before you attempt any aerial activities.
m-zouda.takeoff: The takeoff is done just below the road where you park on the top.
m-zouda.landing: The landing can be done in the riverbed or the field designated on the picture above. The landing area is very thermic and can be turbulent when you approach it.
m-zouda.flying: Before flying, you'll need to visit the Gendarmes before flying or you'll have a (nasty) surprise when you land. This site works really well with thermals.
m-zouda.hazard: This site is extremely thermic and dust devils may occur. Powerlines are extremely present in this area.
m-zouda.legislation: Marrakech ATC must be informed the day before of the start and the end of arial activities. Contact: BAFRA/ Marrakech 05 24 43 04 11 / 05 24 44 79 17.

legzira.name: Legzira
legzira.description: Legzira is one of the most scenic sites in Morocco, near Sidi Ifni. Takeoff at nearly or above cloud base, facing the sea, flying over the famous arches on the beach and land on the beach by the cafés.
legzira.longDescription: Takeoff can be done either on the higher area on the mountain or lower area next to the arch depending on the day conditions. The mountain takeoff is accessible with any type of car.
legzira.takeoff: There are two takeoffs depending on the day's conditions and your ability to go up the piste. Both takeoff are rocky but have been cleaned by previous pilots to minimise the damage on the wings.
legzira.landing: Top landing and landing on the beach are your options. Legzira is a very touristic area and the beach can be easily crowded especially by the cafes. More over the high tide reaches up to the foot of the cliff and cafe really limiting the landing on the beach. In this scenario, it is better to land on the top of the cliff by the arch.
legzira.flying: The top takeoff is subject to sea mist greatly reducing the visibility and disabling takeoff.
legzira.hazard: Mist is to be considered when flying in this area. The crowd on the beach must be avoided as they have no awareness about paragliding. Scorpions live under rocks in this area and it is advised to not turn rocks.

imsouane.name: Imsouane
imsouane.description: Imsouane is a very famous surf spot with it's continuous and easy wave regime. It is less known for paragliding but there is an amazing ridge to soar.
imsouane.longDescription: The takeoff is easily accessible by car and the landing can be done at the top avoiding the trees, coffee truck and tourists or at the beach minding the tourists down there. The dominant wind direction in this area is from the N or NW which makes this site NOT FLYABLE. The terrain generate rotor in the flying area.
imsouane.takeoff: The top of the hill is cliff like except for the small area indicated in this page. It is recommended to takeoff where the land is smoother and rounded.
imsouane.landing: Top landing is easily down when the conditions are right. The bottom landing is down on the beach as long as you avoid people as it is an extremely touristic area. The tide may completely cover the beach.
imsouane.flying: The site is not often flown as the ridge direction is not ideal for the dominant winds in this area (from the North or North West).
imsouane.hazard: The cliff like top may create turbulences for takeoff and top landing, special caution need to be adopted. DO NOT FLY THIS SITE WHEN THE WIND IS NW OR N. Rotors are generated from the terrain lower down which makes the landing on the beach vary dangerous. TIDE: high tide goes right at the bottom of the cliff removing all the landing options on the beach. The only option left to land is a flat land on the ridge by the village.

cookies.title: Cookie policy
cookies.subtitle: At Flymorocco, we are committed to protecting your privacy. This Cookie Policy explains how and why cookies may be used on our website.
cookies.banner: We use cookies to display reviews and improve your experience.

q1.a: Cookies are small text files stored on your device (computer, tablet, smartphone) when you visit websites. They help websites remember information about your visit, such as your language preferences or login status.

q2.a: Flymorocco use cookies to collect anonymous information or track user behavior through Google Analytics. This helps up improve your experience. You have the control to opt-out through our cookie consent banner.

q3.a: Certain features embedded on our website may use third-party services that set cookies on your device. These include: Google Reviews widget, Trustpilot widget. These services may use cookies for functionality, analytics, or personalization related to their respective platforms. The use of cookies by these third-party services is governed by their own privacy and cookie policies, which we encourage you to review.

q4.a: You can control and manage cookie settings directly from your browser. Most browsers allow you to: block cookies entirely, delete cookies after visiting websites, receive alerts before cookies are stored. Please note that disabling cookies may impact the functionality of third-party widgets displayed on our website.

q5.a: If you have any questions about our use of cookies, you can contact us with the link below.
